Class TemplateEngine

java.lang.Object
webfx.devs.TemplateEngine
public class TemplateEngine extends Object
The main class that runs the lightweight TemplateEngine. It replaces values encapsulated with {{}}, with the appropriate injected data.

The template engine runs by default, but setting the value of running to false, prevents the template from performing operations on rendered templates

To turn off the engine, call setRunning(false)

  • Method Details

    • injectData

      public static void injectData(Path output, String content, String data)
      Injects data into the template and writes it to the specified Path.

      This can be used whether or not the engine is running. TemplateEngine.setRunning() sets whether or not the template runs

      Parameters:
      output - The destination path (Path can be obtained from Path.of(URI))
      content - The raw template string with placeholders
      data - JSON string representing key-value pairs

    • clearPlaceholders

      public static void clearPlaceholders(Path output, String content)
      Clears all the placeholders in a given Path and rewrites the template

      This can be used whether or not the engine is running. TemplateEngine.setRunning() sets whether or not the template runs

      Parameters:
      output - , The Path of the template to write to
      content - , The contents of the template. Can call (ResourceManager.readFromTemplate()) to get this.

    • clearPlaceholders

      public static String clearPlaceholders(String content)
      Clears all the placeholders in the template

      This can be used whether or not the engine is running. TemplateEngine.setRunning() sets whether or not the template runs

      Parameters:
      content - , The contents of the template. Can call (ResourceManager.readFromTemplate()) to get this.
      Returns:
      String of the new content

    • addStylesheet

      public static boolean addStylesheet(String filename)
      Adds a stylesheet from it's given filename using the ResourceManager's currently set external Path i.e. directoryName and filename.

      Stylesheet must be located in resources/styles

      This is done by fetching the stylesheet with the given filename and adding a <link> to the html that the Path is represents.

      This can be used whether or not the engine is running. TemplateEngine.setRunning() sets whether or not the template runs

      Parameters:
      filename - , The name of the stylesheet that's being added
      Returns:
      boolean true if successful, false otherwise

    • addStylesheet

      public static boolean addStylesheet(Path output, String filename)
      Adds a stylesheet to a given Path.

      Stylesheet must be located in resources/styles

      This is done by fetching the stylesheet with the given filename and adding a <link> to the html that the Path is represents

      This can be used whether or not the engine is running. TemplateEngine.setRunning() sets whether or not the template runs

      Parameters:
      output - , The Path of the template to write to
      filename - , The name of the stylesheet that's being added
      Returns:
      boolean true if successful, false otherwise

    • isRunning

      public static boolean isRunning()
      Get whether or not the engine runs when templates are rendered
      Returns:
      true if the template engine is active; false otherwise

    • setRunning

      public static void setRunning(boolean running)
      Set whether or not the engine runs when templates are rendered
      Parameters:
      running - The boolean attribute that determines if the template engine runs or not
